title: P05-1076

sentences.text: This paper describes a novel system for acquiring adjectival subcategorization frames -LRB- scfs -RRB- and associated frequency information from English corpus data .
The system incorporates a decision-tree classifier for 30 scf types which tests for the presence of grammatical relations -LRB- grs -RRB- in the output of a robust statistical parser .
It uses a powerful pattern-matching language to classify grs into frames hierarchically in a way that mirrors inheritance-based lexica .
The experiments show that the system is able to detect scf types with 70 % precision and 66 % recall rate .
A new tool for linguistic annotation of scfs in corpus data is also introduced which can considerably alleviate the process of obtaining training and test data for subcategorization acquisition .

summary: This paper describes a novel system for acquiring adjectival subcategorization frames -LRB- scfs -RRB- and associated frequency information from English corpus data . The system incorporates a decision-tree classifier for 30 scf types which tests for the presence of grammatical relations -LRB- grs -RRB- in the output of a robust statistical parser . It uses a powerful pattern-matching language to classify grs into frames hierarchically in a way that mirrors inheritance-based lexica . The experiments show that the system is able to detect scf types with 70 % precision and 66 % recall rate . A new tool for linguistic annotation of scfs in corpus data is also introduced which can considerably alleviate the process of obtaining training and test data for subcategorization acquisition .

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' connects a subject (typically an entity or concept) to its characteristics, features, or properties that are being explained or summarized. It indicates that the subject has certain attributes or qualities that are being described.

Predicate-incorporates.label: incorporates
Predicate-incorporates.description: Incorporates indicates that the subject integrates or includes the object as an essential part of its functionality, architecture, or design. This predicate suggests a close relationship between the subject and object, where the object becomes a fundamental component or mechanism within the subject.

Predicate-tests.label: tests
Predicate-tests.description: The predicate 'tests' indicates that the subject evaluates or examines the object to determine its quality, accuracy, or validity. It suggests a process of verification, validation, or assessment where the subject puts the object through some kind of scrutiny.

Predicate-uses.label: uses
Predicate-uses.description: The predicate 'uses' indicates that the subject has some kind of relationship with or relies on the object. This can imply possession, dependence, utilization, or exploitation, among other possible connections.

Predicate-show_that.label: show that
Predicate-show_that.description: To demonstrate or prove something through evidence or demonstration, typically indicating a conclusion or outcome.

Predicate-can_considerably_alleviate_the.label: can considerably alleviate the process of obtaining training and test data for
Predicate-can_considerably_alleviate_the.description: This predicate indicates that the subject has a significant impact on reducing the effort or difficulty involved in acquiring training and testing datasets necessary for achieving the object. In other words, it suggests that the subject makes it easier to obtain the required data, thereby facilitating the process of subcategorization acquisition (or any similar task) by significantly alleviating its challenges.

Predicate-introduced_which_can_considera.label: introduced which can considerably alleviate
Predicate-introduced_which_can_considera.description: The predicate 'introduced which can considerably alleviate' indicates that a subject (typically an innovation or solution) has been brought into existence, and as a result, it significantly reduces the difficulty or complexity associated with achieving a specific goal or process. The connection between the subject and object is one of causality, where the introduction of the subject leads to a notable alleviation of the described process.

Predicate-is_able_to_detect.label: is able to detect
Predicate-is_able_to_detect.description: Indicates that the subject has a capability or capacity to recognize, identify, or perceive the object. The predicate suggests an ability to detect patterns, features, characteristics, or properties of the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is a specific instance or subclass of the object concept. It represents an is-a relationship, where the subject is a more detailed or specialized version of the object.
